rev.comment: /* Criticism */ okay, these are dumb items to tag, but here you go...
rev.diff:
Line 46: Line 46:
===Criticism===
===Criticism===
â
[[Alan Caruba]], a corporate [[public relations]] {{fact}}campaigner, vocal [[global warming skeptic]]{{fact}}, and founder of the [[National Anxiety Center]], writes "Source Watch is a project of the Center of Media & Democracy, a [[Left-wing politics|left-wing]] organization that devotes a lot of time to attacking the public relations profession in general and [[Conservatism|conservative]] writers in particular."<ref>[[Alan Caruba]], [http://www.expertclick.com/NewsReleaseWire/default.cfm?Action=ReleaseDetail&ID=11499 "Smearing Conservative Writers"], online posting, ''expertclick.com'', rpt. news release (letter), [[National Anxiety Center]], [[January 29]], [[2006]], accessed [[June 25]], [[2007]].</ref>
+
[[Alan Caruba]], a corporate [[public relations]] counselor<ref name=CO>Alan Caruba, [http://www.caruba.com/credentials.htm "Caruba's credentials"], The Caruba Organization, accessed [[June 25]], [[2007]].</ref>, vocal [[global warming skeptic]]<ref>Alan Caruba, [http://www.anxietycenter.com/warning/v9n1.htm "Warning Signs: "Global warming on steroids"], National Anxiety Center, [[January 3]], [[2007]].</ref>, and founder of the [[National Anxiety Center]], writes "Source Watch is a project of the Center of Media & Democracy, a [[Left-wing politics|left-wing]] organization that devotes a lot of time to attacking the public relations profession in general and [[Conservatism|conservative]] writers in particular."<ref>[[Alan Caruba]], [http://www.expertclick.com/NewsReleaseWire/default.cfm?Action=ReleaseDetail&ID=11499 "Smearing Conservative Writers"], online posting, ''expertclick.com'', rpt. news release (letter), [[National Anxiety Center]], [[January 29]], [[2006]], accessed [[June 25]], [[2007]].</ref>
In a profile of SourceWatch, ''[[Discover the Networks]]'', a division of the [[David Horowitz Freedom Center]], which describes itself as "A Guide to the Online Left", writes that the "perspectives [of SourceWatch] are mostly [[Left-wing politics|leftist]]; the entries rely heavily on leftist and far-leftist sources."<ref name=DTNSW>[http://www.discoverthenetworks.org/groupprofile.asp?grpid=7352 Profile of SourceWatch], accessed [[June 25]], [[2007]].</ref><ref>Cf. phrase "a left-leaning group" used to describe SourceWatch in Elizabeth Solomont, [http://www.nysun.com/article/56901?page_no=1 "Big Pharma Readies Effort To Counter Moore's 'Sicko'"], ''[[The New York Sun]]'', [[June 20]], [[2007]]: 2, accessed [[June 25]], [[2007]] (3 pages). (''[[The New York Sun]]'' is generally considered a [[Right-wing politics|right-leaning]] newspaper.)</ref>
In a profile of SourceWatch, ''[[Discover the Networks]]'', a division of the [[David Horowitz Freedom Center]], which describes itself as "A Guide to the Online Left", writes that the "perspectives [of SourceWatch] are mostly [[Left-wing politics|leftist]]; the entries rely heavily on leftist and far-leftist sources."<ref name=DTNSW>[http://www.discoverthenetworks.org/groupprofile.asp?grpid=7352 Profile of SourceWatch], accessed [[June 25]], [[2007]].</ref><ref>Cf. phrase "a left-leaning group" used to describe SourceWatch in Elizabeth Solomont, [http://www.nysun.com/article/56901?page_no=1 "Big Pharma Readies Effort To Counter Moore's 'Sicko'"], ''[[The New York Sun]]'', [[June 20]], [[2007]]: 2, accessed [[June 25]], [[2007]] (3 pages). (''[[The New York Sun]]'' is generally considered a [[Right-wing politics|right-leaning]] newspaper.)</ref>
